tap @ tap & bottle: woah, I was looking forward to tasting this one, given that I like that style and a top50 is most often an indicator of good quality. However, the Ponto really doesnÂ’t agree with my palate at all. The nose is a lovely mix of many US, NZ and EU hops which clearly indicates that this is an IPA or even an IIPA in hop-character. The taste is where it breaks down for me, there is a sharp bitterness which I usually associate with hop pellet chewing. This taste goes over into an aftertaste of metallic and mineralic with even more hop pellet character. Seeing as I have this problem with quite a few of the NE-style IPAs it could just be my palate or something went slightly wrong with the process here. Definitely not my kind of thing.

Can shared adamantly by GT2 on the RBWG bus tour. Pours a clear blonde. Aroma is really nice of sweet pineapple cake, flowers, and sage. Flavor has more spruce presence, nice floral notes. Surprising dryness at the end. Quite nice.

You look at the color and think it is a pilsner. Bright yellow color but the hops just come blasting through here. Great wheat and light malt background for the hop bitterness to play in. A great six pack.
16 oz can shared by Ferris. Pours a clear yellow color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have resiny, weedy, decent malt base, it is exactly what it claims to be; a session IPA.
Can pour light yellow. Nose weedy, resin, slight cat strong aromatic. Taste similar to nose up front followed by some sweet and then bitter. Late mid palate moderate malt. Light bitter finish.

Can. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is dank, orange, and herbal hops with biscuit malt and pear esters. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness with light malt, fruity esters and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Can - Skunky weedy hops. Pale gold with a thin white head. Bitter leafy fresh hop ale. Bitter and dank but nice and clean finish.
Can. Pours yellow gold with white head. Nose and taste of grassy hop, pine, light malt. Medium body
Can thanks to gt. Light yellow appearance. Dank and spicy and herbal. Some fruits. Dry cracker. Minimal bitterness. Drinks good. Pete.

Can thanks to GT2. Pours clear pale golden with a large white head and good lacing. Aroma is very floral and citrus, a bit like an all purpose cleaner. Flavor is the same, lightly sweet, light bitter, very floral. As the beer breathes the cleaner notes fade and what is left is decidedly better. Light body, a bit watery, which is not surprising considering ABV. Flavorful for sure, initially too floral but get more dank and citrusy as it opens up. I am conflicted on rating this one for sure.

Pour is pale yellow with a tight white head. Nose is strong gain bill, a strong doughy component, lots of citrus hops a touch herbal. Taste is similar, lots of fresh grain and bread crust with a bit of doughy caramel flavor. Hops are fairly strong in back, herbal and citrusy with low bitterness and a moderate carbonation on a light body.

Vintage:2014

Overall: Great SIPA, true to style. The body is lacking, but thatÂ’s to be expected given the style. Wonderful hop character and complexity.
Loved it. Great flavor. Way more than you expect from a session beer. Just had a small taste at a beer share.
Love this IPA, thank you GT2, can from the brewery, drank on new years eve, good stuff

16oz can in a tulip. Pours golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of floral and citrusy hops, some pale malts, light grains, and dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. A nice hoppy beer for how light it is.
Can thanks to Justin! Super danky aroma very clear light yellow color. Medium white head. Taste is danky with a very light malt backbone. Almost watery. But overall solid.

Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Pours a clear, pale golden color with white head. Big danky hop aroma dominates the nose. More big danky, piney, floral hop character in the flavor followed by some light toasty malt.

Can. Pours with a clear yellow hued body with a large and retentive white head. Great lace. Aromas are of citrus, melon, resin, grapefruit, lightly tropical with a bit of cracker like malt. Flavors are bitter and dry. Resiny, very fresh, easy to drink. Grapefruit, lightly tropical. Bitterness lingers a bit. Low bodied, fuller carbonation.

16oz can thanks to GT. Light yellow with a small white head. Big hoppy aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, pine and melon. Flavor is mostly bitter hops with minimal malt sweetness and lots of hop flavor. Light thin body with average carbonation. Very good session beer, fresh and hoppy. Thanks GT.

Canned from Bevmo. Nose has a pretty good piney hoppiness to it, with a touch of sweetness. Straightforward grapefruit bitterness up front. Fairly one dimension. Finish is lacking. Decent brew, but not a great IPA.

"Session" IPAs need their own category... this would rate a bit higher in every category. Still a very good beer, just muted in the category.

Pours more yellow than gold with a light fluffy white head, and leaves some sparse lacing. Aroma is fantastic, just muted. Grass, pine, citrus, little bready malt and some floral. Taste is similar with a nice grapefruit bitterness at the finish. One of the best session IPAs IÂ’ve had.

On tap at the brewpub. Very drinkable, lighter IBU IPA. Nice one. Light golden colour.Earlier Rating: 2/10/2007 Total Score: 3.6Lacey beer on-tap at Solena Beach.  A bit of yeast and light grapefruit, very bitter pale yet still goes down well. Middle plus mouthfeel. Fresh tasting, as they go through quite a lot of beer here.

Can from Pizza Port San Clemente. Holy crap, what a good value! 96oz for $10 flat! Love cans! Pours a crystal clear golden yellow with moderate white head. Aroma is grassy and floral hop with a slight metalic nose at the end. Taste is very hop forward with a light body. Not watery like some "session" IPAs these days. Really holds up to Founders All Day IPA and for a fraction of the price.

text: Can. Hazy pale glowing gold. Spicy hop aroma. Very bitter, leafy, almost soapy. A session ipa. Better than "all day ipa" bit similar.

Pours pale gold. Nose is really bad ass with dank fruits, citrus, floral, and grass. Flavor is similar but has that element of sharp hops, grass and light citric acidity that you typically get in session IPAs but this one is a little more mild. Overall I really liked it.

text: Pours a light orange-yellow with a two finger white head with very nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, dank hops, herbal grassy hops, sweet malts and some tropical fruits. On tap at Pizza Port Solana Beach, pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of piney hops, and crackery malt to back. Flavour is very dry, with dry floral hops and bone dry crackery malt. Highly drinkable and refreshing. Good stuff.

On tap at Carlsbad... Pours a hazy pale blonde hue and topped with a creamy white head... Light crisp citrus overtones. Clean ... Light crisp grassy citrus and big dryness overall to pair with a mild bitter finish. Lighter bodied with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 On tap @ Pizza Port Bressi Ranch. Pale yellow pour with a white head. Aromas of pine, pineapple, and grapefruit. Nice sweet citrus aromas. Doughy malt, too. Mild sweetness to the flavor. Good fruit character and a touch of malt. Nice pineapple and grapefruit. A touch of pineapple sweetness.
Sampled at gabf. From my notes. pours an amber gold with an off white head. big hop aroma and taste
On tap at GABF 2013, nice citrus and pine aroma and taste, smooth bitter finish.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy flavor. has a fruity malty peachy hoppy finish.
clear amber color, thin white head, strong hop presence, straw flavor, rye? dry hops, big hops for a pale, bold hop fruit flavor
On tap at PP Solana.  Frothy tap head.  Amber color.  Low bitterness.  Low hop aroma.  Early boil bitterness.

The finish is citrusy hops with a lingering bitter aftertaste. Pretty good all around.
On tap at the brewery.  Tastes more like an IPA.  Sweet aroma and taste, citrus notes, and a bitter bite.  Good.
Solana Beach.  Copper, off-white head with nice lacing.  Lemon & slight malt nose.  Flavor is straw malt, strawberry patch, hops are very well balanced.  Wonderful bitter straw malt/hop finish.

Cask at pizza port. flat with an amber body. hoppy nose, but not so much in the body. Reminded me a lot of the cask pales i had throughout england.  Different than what im used to in a pale, but not overally exciting.
Draft at Pizza Port Solana Beach: Amber, nose of light hops and a bit of malts. The flavor is smooth, light, good. A bit hard to cut through all the hops from their other beers comparatively.

On tap from the brewpub. Tasted during trip to California. Light amber colour. Great aroma of fresh fruit from the hops. Very nice tasty american pale ale. Very hoppy endeed, that also ends bitter and dry, with a nice balance between the diffrent hops.

Tap @ Solana. Semi clear golden amber w large bubble slightly off white head that fell fairly quick. Aroma is hops & lt/med roast malt. Flavor is dry, bitter, hoppy w med roast malt. Most bitter pale ale in SD? I dont know about that but good all the same. A dark orange color with a citrusy and hoppy nose. A good amount of malt balancing out the hops. A strong grapefruit presence in this one. Quite acidic and bitter aftertaste. Oh yeah!

Crystal clear, golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. Very fruity aroma... tropical and fuzzy fruits. Well-bittered and balanced flavor with bursts of caramel, toffee and more fuzzy fruit. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Lengthy, bitter, dry finish. An excellent American Pale Ale. Thanks to DrunkAsASkunk for sharing his pint!

Definitely a very fresj and pleasant APA, thats for sure. It pours a dark yellow slight orange hue with a slight white head which dissipates rather quickly. Some definite carbonation up front, but it calmed down toward the finish. Pleasant aroma of fresh hops (damn i love San Diego) and woody earth and pineyness. A hint of malt rounds out this aroma. The taste is nearly all hops and pine. Good freshness, a little bit of citric quality, and a nice bite to the semi-dry finish. Good mouthfeel, a little acidic but overall very nice.
A good american pale ale, grapefruit, bitter, lingering aftertaste.

Cask at brewpub.  Slightly hazy amber coloer with a small off-white head.  Nice floral and piney hop aroma. Flavor is delicious - sweet malt backbone but dominated by the hoppiness.  Smooth, medium body and light carbonation.
A decently flavored pale ale with nothing too exciting about it.  It has all the features of a good pale ale, yet it lacks the depth of a great one.  Great piney nose and flavor though.

This pale ale pours with a deep amber body topped by a medium thick, off-whtie head with good lacing. The aroma is slightly sweet yet slightly bitter and malty with a slight citrusy hoppiness.  The flavor is slighlty sweet to start but turns bitter, slighlty citrusy, slightly piney and hoppy, but not overwhelmingly so.  Medium bodied, relatively smooth and dry.
UPDATED: MAR 3, 2004 It first tastes to me like another over the top San Diego IPA, but NO. Hop aroma, sweet candy taste and bitter IPA finish. How isn't this an IPA?
